original_title: Sri Lanka police probing cash loss in central bank
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s central bank said it had complained to police over the loss of 5 million rupees in cash in 5,000  rupee notes, on April 11.
“An internal probe into the matter was commenced immediately, while a complaint was also lodged at the Fort Police Station,” a statement said.

“The Central Bank is taking necessary measures to thoroughly investigate the incident and strengthen the internal controls, processes, etc. It will also continue assisting the Police to carry out its investigations.”
